page.title: 02HOUSING
page.content: Clipston village dates back to the Domesday Book itself when it was known as Clippeston. Many old houses have been demolished to make way for newer developments. However, there are some original dwellings that have been modernised in more recent years. The layout of the roads in the village is almost the same as nine centuries ago. The population is 470, living in mainly privately owned houses. The village comprises of approximately 140 private properties and 42 Council owned, 12 of which have now been sold off to private ownership. A survey within the village provided the following information: The west of the village has 31 old and 35 new properties. The east has 25 old and 42 new properties. The High Street has 18 old and 5 new. Any property over 50 years was classed as old.
